pullrequest.title: Preparations for apps to be restructured as standard Python packages

content.raw:
As opposed to just letting the user put their code anywhere?

The profile creation tool needs to know where user code is so that it can add it to the Python import path and make it importable system-wide. So at the moment we say “there is a profile directory that the user chooses at profile creation time, and userlib is a hard-coded folder within it”. We could also say “at profile creation time, please tell us what locations you are going to put your code”, in addition to the location where labconfig and log files will be,  but I don’t think the hard-coding approach has been the cause of any heartache.
